div1.p: Carter discusses details of a future trip to an unnamed location.

div1.head: Letter from Henry Rose Carter to William Crawford Gorgas, January 23, 1920
div1.opener:
5. Miss
Gorgas,
Washington, D. C.,
January 23, 1920.
General William C. Gorgas,
The Highlands,
Washington, D. C.
Dear Dr. Gorgas:
div1.p:
I sent a letter to your New York address,
61 Broadway, which came up from Tampa on the same
train I did--naturally it will be a day or so be-
for you get it.

I stopped off here intending to see you if
by chance you were here. Perry tells me that you
are here, but are engaged today (Pan-American
Financial Congress). As it isn't suitable weather
for elderly gentlemen-dressed for South Florida-
to wander around Washington in, I am going on
home,-if only to get into warmer clothes, and con-
sequently write this.

I can make my arrangements to go with you in
the early part of April February. It will require my
application for waiting orders, which I will put
in today or when I hear from you.

I would like to know, (1) the scope of the
work in which I will be engaged and as much in de-
tail as you can give. The traveling kit I am to
provide depends on this, that is where I am likely
to go and for how long; (2) If you know yet, on
what day you sail and from what port and by what
vessel.

I could come over and see you at any time if
you think I had better do so. I am to be over at
the Bureau part of next week on a board to revise
quarantine regulations, so it would be convenient
enough.

For some reasons--viz. I had not hurt my back--I wish I had gone
with you last August (when Perry thought I was not well enough to go),
I was able to do field work from August 4th. on, and did do it until I
hurt my back--November 16th.--up to which time I was perfectly well.

However, I had missed doing what will lessen the malaria in the
U. S. by at least 25,000 cases--possibly 50,000--per annum and I judge
that was better worth doing than what I had done in yellow fever work.
div1.closer: Very truly your friend, (Signed) H. R. Carter.
